titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lee Kaplan Collection on Julius Hemphill MSS.580
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 17:03:38 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid updated by Lauren Stark to reflect 2022 accretion and collection processing.

did.unittitle: Lee Kaplan Collection on Julius Hemphill

physdesc.extent: in 1 half manuscript box and 2 folders in shared housing

did.abstract: Lee Kaplan (born 1956) is a Los Angeles musician, concert producer, bookseller, and former record buyer for Rhino Records in the 1970s. Kaplan owned the record label Aten Records and produced a concert series at the Century City Playhouse from 1976-1982, which focused on creative improvisation and featured artists such as the Art Ensemble of Chicago, Oliver Lake, Horace Tapscott, and John Zorn. The Lee Kaplan Collection on Julius Hemphill consists of materials collected by Kaplan documenting the musical career of saxophonist Julius Hemphill. Materials include audio recordings and ephemeral materials by the Janus Company (Julius Hemphill, Baikida Carroll, and Alex Cline); an unreleased, professionally recorded and mastered 12" 45 RPM vinyl recording with music by the Janus Company produced by Kaplan; and printed flyers for solo and ensemble performances by Hemphill at the Century City Playhouse.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Lee Kaplan in May 2019 and November 2022; the accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2019.040 and 2023.038.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in alphabetical order.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lee Kaplan (born 1956) is a Los Angeles musician, concert producer, bookseller, and former record buyer for Rhino Records in the 1970s. Kaplan owned the record label Aten Records and produced a concert series at the Century City Playhouse from 1976-1982, which focused on creative improvisation and featured artists such as the Art Ensemble of Chicago, Oliver Lake, Horace Tapscott, and John Zorn.

phystech.head: Born-Digital Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact Fales Library and Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596, with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Lee Kaplan Collection on Julius Hemphill; MSS 580; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level. During processing, materials were arranged and described, and born-digital items were forensically imaged, arranged, and described. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lee Kaplan Collection on Julius Hemphill consists of materials collected by Kaplan documenting the musical career of saxophonist Julius Hemphill. Materials include audio recordings by the Janus Company (Julius Hemphill, Baikida Carroll, and Alex Cline); an unreleased, professionally recorded and mastered 12" 45 RPM vinyl recording with music by The Janus Company, produced by Kaplan; printed flyers for solo and ensemble performances by Hemphill at the Century City Playhouse; liner notes for the Janus Company recording done in New York City on December 10, 1977; two photographs of the Janus Company in Los Angeles, circa 1978; and receipts for the recording studio session and album pressings, 1979.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

did.unittitle: The Janus Company Ephemera and Photographs
